headline: Caramel Candy
description: This microwave Caramel Candy recipe makes soft, melt-in-your-mouth caramels that everyone loves! Made with only 5 ingredients, they are a family tradition.

recipeInstructions.text: Be VERY cautious when making, stirring, and pouring caramel candy because it is super hot.
recipeInstructions.name: Be VERY cautious when making, stirring, and pouring...

recipeInstructions.text: In a very, large microwave-safe bowl, put the butter, sweetened condensed milk, sugar, and corn syrup. Microwave on high for 5 minutes and then stir.
recipeInstructions.name: In a very, large microwave-safe bowl, put the...

recipeInstructions.text: Microwave at 50% power in 5 minutes intervals for 15-25 minutes total, or until caramel reaches 238˚F to 244˚F on a candy thermometer. They have to be a deep golden caramel color and should form a soft ball in cold water.
recipeInstructions.name: Microwave at 50% power in 5 minutes intervals...

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from the microwave and stir in the vanilla extract.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from the microwave and stir in the...

recipeInstructions.text: Pour caramels into a lightly buttered 9×13″ pan. Cool completely at room temperature.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour caramels into a lightly buttered 9×13″ pan....

recipeInstructions.text: Cut into squares and wrap in waxed paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut into squares and wrap in waxed paper.

recipeInstructions.text: Store in an airtight container the refrigerator or freezer.
recipeInstructions.name: Store in an airtight container the refrigerator or...
